referable-content.title: [RC steps] Locking and Unlocking Hosts for TiS 16
referable-content.shortdesc: You can lock a host in order to change its configuration, or unlock it to make it available for use.

context.p: Unlocking causes the host to be rebooted so that its configuration can be updated.

note.p: A newly added host is locked by default. To make it operational, you must unlock it manually.

prereq.p: Ensure that the required network interfaces have been defined.

li.p: Before you can unlock a compute host, at least one data interface to an existing provider network is required.
Before you can unlock a storage host, an interface to the infrastructure network is required.

step.cmd: Lock the host to prepare it for configuration changes.

info.p: On the Hosts tab of the Host Inventory page, open the drop-down list for the host, and then select Lock Host.
The host is locked and reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online.

step.cmd: On the Hosts tab of the Host Inventory page, open the drop-down list for the host to display a menu of actions.

choice.p: To unlock a locked host, click Unlock Host. The host is rebooted, and its Availability State is reported as In-Test. After a few minutes, it is reported as Unlocked, Enabled, and Available.
To lock an unlocked host, click Lock Host, and confirm your selection in the dialog box that appears. The host is locked and reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online.

step.cmd: Unlock the host to make it available for use.

info.p: On the Hosts tab of the Host Inventory page, open the drop-down list for the host, and then select Unlock Host.

stepresult.p: The host is rebooted, and its Availability State is reported as In-Test. After a few minutes, it is reported as Unlocked, Enabled, and Available.
